title: Dele Alli finds new handshake partner in Son Heung-min
title_page: Dele Alli finds new handshake partner in Son Heung-min | Daily Mail Online
text:
Despite Dele Alli's and Harry Kane's choreographed handshake against Everton attracting plenty of unpopular opinion, it appears as if it has caught on at Tottenham's training ground.
Ahead of their Premier League encounter with Southampton on Sunday, Tottenham have been training as they look to push on in the business end of the season.
But they haven't just been training with the ball. With Tottenham confirming that Kane sustained ligament damage in the club's FA Cup victory over Millwall, Alli has found a new partner to practice his handshake moves with.
Dele Alli and Son Heung-min try out a new handshake in Tottenham training on Thursday
Son appears to have replaced Tottenham striker Harry Kane as Alli's new handshake partner
Kieran Trippier and Son share a joke during Tottenham's training session in Enfield
Mauricio Pochettino's side have been training ahead of the league match with Southampton
Alli will be hoping to put Southampton to the sword at White Hart Lane on Sunday
The England international was pictured trying out a new routine with team-mate Son Heung-min on Thursday at their training base in Enfield.
The spirits in the Tottenham camp appeared to be high ahead of Sunday's game at White Hart Lane.
The likes of Alli, Son, Kieran Trippier, Christian Eriksen and Mousa Dembele were all pictured being put through their paces ahead of the weekend's round of league fixtures.
Mauricio Pochettino's side will be hoping to claim another league victory on the weekend against Southampton as they look to keep the pressure on runaway leaders Chelsea.
Spirits in the Tottenham camp appeared to be high ahead of the club's weekend match
Tottenham players were put through their paces by Pochettino on Thursday
Tottenham goalkeeper Hugo Lloris dives for the ball during the club's training session
But they will have to do it without striker Kane after the club confirmed he sustained significant ankle ligament damage in the 6-0 win over Millwall.
Kane rolled his right ankle during the opening stages of the win. The injury was virtually identical to the setback he suffered to the same ankle earlier in the season, causing him to miss seven weeks of the season.
But club medics believe the latest problem isn't as serious as the one suffered against Sunderland in September.
Following the club's match with Southampton, Tottenham players go their separate ways as they link up with their country's to enjoy some international football.
